text:
PostNL has a long history of IT, and in
2014 we closed our last data center,

and in 2018 we decided to take
the next step and go full in on serverless.

And we chose serverless because of the security and
the lower operational burden, but especially for the elasticity
and scalability that serverless offers.
And the Skills Guild has really helped us to train and retrain our engineers to work with that cutting edge technology.

AWS Skills Guild and the training program
that we built

has really helped normalize
learning as part of your day job.
We have a culture of learning.

You need to learn as part of your job,
because otherwise you'll never be able

to keep up with everything
that's changing.
I think there’s so much to learn.

There’s so many new technologies
and there’s so much happening in AWS

and in software development in general,
that just having the experts

in their field share about all
the possibilities has opened many eyes to

what’s possible and has measurable effect
on innovation in our company.

I've always been into knowledge
sharing and educating others,

so having that in a formalized
program and being supported by AWS,

has brought a lot of value
to me, to be able to reach out

to my colleagues and really
help them get to the next level.

The Skills Guild program has
helped us train our engineers and really

taught us how to continue
supporting that internal training program
and that will have a lasting effect far into the future.

PostNL has worked with the AWS Skills
Guild to really retrain

much of our workforce
to focus on AWS serverless

and the new kind of way
you develop software on serverless.

So it’s not just them educating us, but also them
telling us how to build our own training program.

AWS Skills Guild and the training program
that we built

has really helped normalize
learning as part of your day job.
We have a culture of learning.

You need to learn as part of your job,
because otherwise you'll never be able

to keep up with everything
that's changing.
I think there’s so much to learn.

There’s so many new technologies
and there’s so much happening in AWS

and in software development in general,
that just having the experts

in their field share about all
the possibilities has opened many eyes to

what’s possible and has measurable effect
on innovation in our company.

The Skills Guild program has helped us
train our engineers and really set up

a internal training program,
and has also taught us how to continue

supporting that internal training program
and that will have a lasting effect far into the future.
